title: Official Web Site of the IAEA
author: International Atomic Energy Agency
description: The IAEA is the world's centre for cooperation in the nuclear field, promoting the safe, secure and peaceful use of nuclear technology. It works in a wide range of areas including energy generation, health, food and agriculture and environmental protection.
cleaned_text: About the IAEA The IAEA is the world's centre for cooperation in the nuclear field and seeks to promote the safe, secure and peaceful use of nuclear technologies. Growing up in a family that prioritized education, Rola Ghneim Khreis was passionate about science and planned to pursue a degree in physics. However, as she looked over the courses offered at the Lebanese American University in Beirut, she noticed a degree in an emerging field: computer science. [Read more ](/newscenter/news/iaea-profile-rola-ghneim-khreis-the-iaeas-first-woman-director-of-information-technology) The IAEA recommends that nuclear and radiological facilities introduce computer security programmes to counter cyberthreats. [Read more ](/bulletin/what-goes-into-making-a-computer-security-programme) The IAEA, through its Rays of Hope initiative, and St. Jude Children's Research Hospital, through its Global Alliance, are exploring ways to work together to save children's lives through access to quality radiotherapy and diagnostic imaging. [Read more ](/newscenter/news/iaea-and-st-jude-look-to-increase-global-access-to-radiotherapy-for-children-with-cancer) Women from around the world took part in an International School on Nuclear Security at the IAEA in August. It was the fourth time the school had hosted fellows from the IAEA Marie Sklodowska-Curie Fellowship Programme (MSCFP) since the launch of the programme in 2020. [Read more ](/newscenter/news/marie-sklodowska-curie-fellows-trained-in-nuclear-security) Today marks one year since the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) Director General, Rafael Mariano Grossi, visited Zaporizhzhya Nuclear Power Plant (ZNPP) for the first time and established the IAEA Support and Assistance Mission to Zaporizhzhya (ISAMZ). The permanent presence of IAEA experts at ZNPP has been essential in reducing the likelihood of a nuclear accident. [Read more ](/newscenter/pressreleases/update-181-iaea-director-general-statement-on-situation-in-ukraine) IAEA Director General Rafael Mariano Grossi descended deep underground in coastal Sweden this week to study the Nordic nation's advanced preparations for the safe and secure disposal of its spent nuclear fuel, saying they demonstrated the availability of technical solutions for managing such used radioactive material at a time of growing global interest in nuclear energy. [Read more ](/newscenter/news/iaea-director-general-grossi-sees-impressive-work-in-sweden-on-disposal-of-spent-nuclear-fuel-deep-underground) The IAEA is the world's centre for cooperation in the nuclear field and seeks to promote the safe, secure and peaceful use of nuclear technologies.
